{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3559378,"name":"Kelly M","username":"kelmalon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/898d66/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T16:49:10.727Z","cooked":"

I am the programming mentor for FRC Team 8728: The Argonauts. My team used PathPlanner last year with no large issues, and pre-made Paths and Autos this year before competition that we were excited to test with our basic custom swerve code using all WPILIB swerve libraries in Java. We went to the Week 3 FIM Belleville Competition this past weekend, and encountered some very unusual problems with PathPlanner.

When we add a Named Command to an Auto in addition to a Path, the robot runs the Named Command and Path concurrently and not sequentially. To summarize, we were working on a simple Auto to move forward in a straight line from the starting line to the reef, then after the Path is complete run our elevator up and score a coral. Instead of waiting to run the Named Command containing the elevator code until after the Path is complete, both the Path and the elevator/Named Command start moving/running as soon as we enable in Autonomous mode. The Named Command performs the same sequence we expect, but runs while the drivetrain is running and not after the drivetrain stops as it should. We also noticed that the drivetrain does not stop at all when running the Path plus the Named Command Auto, almost as if it is repeating the Path again and again while the Named Command is running. We enlisted the help of both CSAs at the event (shout out to Patrick and Rodney) who ran us through some troubleshooting steps, but were also very confused as to why this was happening.

To attempt to fix the problem we:

  1. SSHed into the RIO and deleted everything in the deploy folder on the RIO = no change

  2. Uninstalled and reinstalled our PathPlanner library files = no change

  3. Added a Wait command to the beginning of our Named Command that was the estimated length of our Path = this did delay the start of the Named Command, but caused us to notice that the Path seemed to be repeating itself and never ended no matter when the Named Command stopped

  4. Put our Path + Named Command sequence within a sequential group within the Auto = no change

  5. Added our Named Command to an Auto we knew worked, which previously had contained a singular path with no Named Commands and worked consistently = same result, ran concurrently

  6. Moved the Named Command to within the Path itself and not within the Auto = no change, ran concurrently

  7. Ran the same Auto file with just the path, no named command = the path ran as expected

  8. Built a command for the Path from the Path file in the deploy folder of the project using “P2_Cross_File = PathPlannerPath.fromPathFile(“P2_Cross”)” and “P2_Cross = AutoBuilder.followPath(P2_Cross_File)”; then added the Path to the Named Command (which is a wpilib Sequential Command Group), manually added the Sequential Command Group to the Auto Chooser like this “autoChooser.addOption(“Test1”, P2_Cross)” and selected and ran the Test1 choice = no change still ran path and the rest concurrently

  9. Changed our Named Command to a Wait Command of 5 seconds and moved it before the Path = Path ran immediately and did not wait at all

  10. Tried #8 again but added a line to the Sequential Command Group that feeds a command to the drivetrain (just our Teleop drive() command with all zeros within an Instant Command), requiring the drivetrain and cancelling the previous drivetrain command = THIS WORKED and ran the Path, stopped, then ran the rest of the Sequential Command Group without the drivetrain running, but to my knowledge in theory this should have cancelled the entire sequential command.

We are using a Sequential Command Group for our Intake sequence in Teleop as well, which works perfectly fine. The solution we landed on in #10 works, but is definitely a hacky fix we should not have to do.

Has anyone seen anything like this before, or have any additional troubleshooting steps we can try at our shop this week before our next Week 4 competition? We would greatly appreciate any input!

Here is a link to our code as well: GitHub - Troy-Argonauts/2025-Reefscape-Robot-Code at Initial_Testing

We were using this specific branch at competition, has not been merged to master yet.
